description: From New Latin erythēma, from Ancient Greek ἐρύθημα (erúthēma, “a redness or flush on the skin”), from ἐρυθρός (eruthrós, “red”).

nouns.description: erythema (countable and uncountable, plural erythemas or erythemata)

entries.meaning: Abnormal redness and inflammation of the skin, due to vasodilation.
Skin redness from sunburn or chemical irritation
